title: Turkic Languages: From Istanbul to Siberia
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Turkic Languages: From Istanbul to Siberia.

buildup.text: The Turkic family includes Turkish, Azerbaijani, Uzbek, Kazakh, Turkmen, Kyrgyz, and others.

discovery.text: Turkic languages spread from Central Asia with nomadic warriors over the past 2,000 years.

twist.text: Yakut (Sakha) is spoken near the Arctic Circle in Siberia â€” the northernmost Turkic language.

climax.text: Despite huge distances, Turkic languages remain remarkably similar â€” more than Romance languages do.

punchline.text: Horse riders carried one language across the widest continent and barely changed it.

quiz.question: Why are Turkic languages still so similar despite covering a vast area?
options: They spread relatively recently and stayed in contact through nomadic culture
They were standardized by a central government
They all use the same alphabet
